Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: reserved handle zone with black-figure decoration consisting of part of vertical handle palmette and tendril with added red on heart.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.439.a-b and 1888,0601.243. Venit incorrectly labels sherd 1888,0601.439.a-b as 1888,0601.439.b-c (Venit 1982, 416-17). British Museum 1888,0601.439.c does not join 1888,0601.439.a-b.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0566) (Phase 1)
